name: UpdateRunnerGroupSettings
description:
Update name and visibility of a runner group in an organization.

Call this tool to change the name or visibility of a self-hosted runner group within a GitHub organization. Requires authentication with an access token that has the `admin:org` scope.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The name of the organization. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: runner_group_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group being updated.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group.

parameters.name: runner_group_name
parameters.description: The new name for the self-hosted runner group in the organization.

parameters.name: allowed_workflow_list
parameters.description: List of workflows the runner group can run. Ignored unless workflows are restricted.

value_schema.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

parameters.name: runner_group_visibility
parameters.description: Specifies the visibility of the runner group. Options: 'selected' for individual repositories, 'all' for all repositories, 'private' for all private repositories.

value_schema.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all repositories, select individual repositories, or all private repositories.

parameters.name: allow_public_repository_usage
parameters.description: Set to `true` to allow the runner group to be used by public repositories.

value_schema.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

parameters.name: restrict_runner_group_to_workflows
parameters.description: Set to `true` to restrict the runner group to running only the workflows specified in `selected_workflows`.

value_schema.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: org
parameters.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: runner_group_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group.

parameters.name: allows_public_repositories
parameters.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

value_schema.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

parameters.name: restricted_to_workflows
parameters.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

value_schema.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

parameters.name: selected_workflows
parameters.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

value_schema.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all repositories, select individual repositories, or all private repositories.

value_schema.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all repositories, select individual repositories, or all private repositories.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
